Claire awoke as her father left the house. As her father spent the day at work, and her mother spent the day glued to her work-at-home computer, she spent the day gorging. After she woke up, she walked over to the chip cabinet, grabbed a bowl, filled it with Hickory Wavy. and walked over to the couch to watch some television. The couch obligatorily groaned as she plopped her morbidly obese body on the sofa. She moved her lardy arm to grab chips from the chip bowl and shove them into her mouth as she watched her hospital show. On her next trip, she got the whole bag and carried it to the couch. As she polished this off, she got up to grab the 18 bar pack of candy bars. She munched the numerous candy bars as she continued on.

She was stuffed for a little bit, but inevitably, as lunchtime rolled around, she was hungry again. So she grabbed some bread, some cooked bacon, and some cheese, and slapped it all together into a sandwich with an ungodly amount of bacon and cheese that she proceeded to hork down, washed down with some sour cream and onion chips. After this, she dug into her post-lunch snacks. Counted among these were the multitudes of snack cakes, a few slices of cheesecake, and the remainder of the sour cream and onion.

As she polished off the sour cream and onion, her father opened the door, recieved his kiss from Jenn, and walked to the back. After he had changed into his regular clothes, he walked back into the living room as Jenn relaxed on the sofa. "Get your shoes on, we're going somewhere." Claire nodded, put her shoes on, and followed Ron.

Eventually they arrived at the office. Claire peeked out the windows, now flecked with november frost. She couldn't quite make out the name on it. She slung on her coat, unbuckled her seatbelt and got out as her father beckoned her out. She looked at the sign: "RIVERSIDE HEALTH AND NUTRITION." She followed her dad unquestioningly. Maybe this was just a visit for him and she was being dragged along. Her father entered the warmth of the clinic. There were a few people here and there sitting on the chairs of the waiting room, which had that odd smell of sterilization, and offices, that unearthly smell that keeps one uneasy. As the desk opened, Ron spoke to the woman behind the counter, an elderly woman with glasses, thin with a harsh tone. "Yessir?" "Hi, I'm Ron White, I'm here for my daughter, Claire White's visit to Doctor Guderian."

Oh. Shit.

Claire's mind began going in panic mode. She felt like bursting out the door, but she'd have no way out. It was either walk home, which was about 7 miles away, steal dad's car and go to jail, or be guilt tripped. None of these options appealed to her. The woman behind the desk spoke. "Ah, yes, Guderian's been prepared." Claire stood up at her father's beckoning, slowly of course, and walked. This is it, she thought, they're going to torture me. The little martyr walked with head held high, like the martyrs of old, as though she was walking to the hangman.

She entered the room as her father introduced her to Guderian. The strange little man had a german accent, and a wrinkled, old face. "Ah, yes, mister white. Gut to see you. Is this your daughter?" Her father nodded. "Yes, Mister Guderian, yes it is." The german man adjusted his glasses. Claire preferred to imagine he was adjusting his evil monocle as he prepared his evil torture machines: A scale, and a clipboard with a sheet of paper. "Now, mister white...Plees have a seet while I assess your daughter's condition." He turned to Claire. "Now, miss white.." he spoke, "Plees take ov your schuss, an' step onto the sceel."

Claire calmly took off her shoes, and stepped onto the elongated white scale, with the blank white screen. It flashed many numbers before cutting to three dots. It came up to a set of numbers: 353. The nutritionist scribbled and spoke. "Hmm. Ant let's check your height, shall ve?" He took her up towards the wall, where there was a painted height measurement. "Fife foot seex. So, your BMI is about feefty-sefen. That means you're Morbidly Obese. Your age and height, you should be 118-145 pounds." As he spoke all of this, claire began feeling worse and worse about herself. The doctor made a continuous amount of tests, taking her blood pressure, and asking a swarm of questions that Claire squirmed to answer.

By the end of it, the doctor had spoken. "Well, mister white, your daughter's in terrible condition. She's got the signs of pre-diabetes, her resting blood pressure is horribly high, her eating habits are unsustainable. I predict that, if she makes no change, by the time of her 19th birthday, she will have developed diabetes, and by the end of that year, she'll have to take high blood pressure medication. I've charted a meal plan for her, and if she sticks to it, the pre-diabetic conditions should dissapear, as well as the blood pressure. I also reccomend an exercise regimen to aid the meal plan." "Thank you, doctor guderian," replied Ron, "We'll be in touch." The two men shook hands and Ron walked out of the office. He didn't have to say anything. Claire, of course, felt horrible. She had let her health slip so far down the drain. When she got back to the house...

Claire immediately slid out of the car and ponderously waddled to the front door, shoving it open and making her way to her room, breathing a bit laboriously. Ron watched her go and shook his head. I really hope I got through to her He sighed inwardly as he walked into the kitchen. Jenn had gotten done with her computer work and had begun preparing dinner, delicious aromas assailing the household. She looked up as Ron grabbed a beer out of the fridge.

"Hello dear!" She asked happily, "How did the new job treat you?" Ron smiled as he bent down and locked lips with his wife.

He then leaned back on the counter, taking a swig. "It was pretty good, I really enjoy the extra responsibility they've given me!" He frowned as he remembered all the extra paper work he had to get done. "They've loaded me down with responsibility, in fact. I can't remember having so much to do!" He laughed ruefully, taking another swig of beer. Jenn hugged him and looked into his eyes.

"It'll be alright sweetie" she murmured, pecking him on the lips, be fore turning and busying herself with cooking. "By the way, I noticed Claire wasn't home for awhile, did you take her with you somewhere?"

Ron looked guiltily down into the depths of his beer, before taking a long drink. "I uh... I took Claire to a nutritionist." He started, still staring down. Jenn looked at him suspiciously, stopping what she was doing.

"And?" She demanded, staring at him with eyes so hard they could cut diamond. She didn't appreciate him doing things behind her back. Ron shuffled his feet and looked anywhere but at his wife.

"Well... He told us that Claire is extremely unhealthy and... and if she continues down the path she's on, she's going to, well, develop diabetes, and a whole host of other complications." Ron finally met his wife's eyes. "I'm sorry, I'm just really worried about her. But I'm glad I did this, I'm sure it will help Claire!"

Jenn said nothing for a long while, and stared up at her husband and spoke in a low, enraged voice. "Do you have any idea what you've done? Do have have any idea what damage you've caused?? You think you we're being helpful?!" Her voice began to rise as she got angrier and angrier. Ron stepped back a bit in astonishment, edging towards the door to his office. Jenn continued, white in the face. "You may have just single handedly ruined our daughters self confidence! Can you even begin to imagine how hard that is to hear, for someone of her age? And you took her to a nutritionist? What could they possibly know?"

Ron started to get angry, and with all of the stress he had felt that day, he shouted back at his wife. "If you think it's such bullshit, why don't you take her to the doctors, and find out for yourself?! Our daughter is unhealthy, and I'm trying my hardest to fix that!" With that he stormed out of the kitchen and into his office. Jenn yelled after his retreating back.

"Maybe I will take her to my doctor, and see what he thinks! And our daughter is perfectly fine!" With that, Jenn slammed her hands on the counter and stood silently fuming. She must be so upset, she thought quietly. I think I'll make her a big meal to cheer her up! And with that, Jenn began preparing a feast of many of Claire's favorite foods, using liberal doses of butter and salt, and the most delicious (and fattening) ingredients.

Jenn stomped upstairs to Claire's room, hands laden with her burdens of the evening. She could hear Claire sobbing through her partially closed door, and Jenn felt herself die a little inside. She hated hearing her daughter so unhappy. Jenn knocked and pushed the door in, poking her head around the corner. Claire was on the bed, laying on her side, her enormous gut spread out before her. Tears streaked her face as she looked up and saw her mom. Desperate for some comfort, she motioned for her mother to come in, laying her head back down and continuing to cry.

Jenn came over and set the tray down on her nightstand, sitting on the edge of the bed next to her daughter. She began silently stroking her hair, and Claire's sobs began to settle, until she just hiccuped and pushed herself up, staring at the tray of food with a wet face. "Mom," she began, "Dad took me to the nutritionist today and-"

Jenn quickly cut her off. "It's okay sweetie, it's okay. I already know. I already had a talk with your father about it." Claire looked up into her face, tears wobbling at the corner of her eyes.

"I'm so scared Mom, the things that man told me..."

"Are completely untrue." Jenn stared down into her daughter's eyes. "I don't trust that nutritionist's opinion even for a second. And you shouldn't either. You're perfectly healthy Claire." She smiled , and Claire shakily smiled back.

"You... you don't think I'm overweight?" She asked haltingly.

"No." Jenn said firmly. "You're at a good, healthy weight. Curves are a good thing sweetie." She gave Claire a tight hug, barely reaching halfway around her. "Now, how about we tuck into some dinner! I made your favorites!"

Claire looked at the food nervously. "But the doctor said-"

Jenn cut her off immediately. "He doesn't know what he was talking about. I doubt he was even a real doctor!" Claire was still looking hesitant, so Jenn sighed and looked her daughter straight in the eye. "How about this sweetie: I will eat with you, and match everything you eat. That way we'll prove that he was full of it, because I'll be eating the same as you, and I'm in prime health! In fact, I could use a bit more curves. I've lost more than was healthy for me!" Claire looked at her mother in astonishment and smiled, reaching towards the tray and grabbing a plate of buttery mashed potatoes. She dug in with gusto and sighed happily, the buttery, caloric goodness sliding down her throat into her empty belly. Jenn smiled at her daughter and grabbed a plate for herself.

As Claire demolished the food on the tray, she could feel her stomach getting tighter and tighter. Jenn was also putting quite a dent in the food as well, matching her daughter bite for bite, although she was much, much fuller. As Jenn began to feel sick, Claire finished the last bit of food and leaned back, sighing contently, and began rubbing her stuffed gut. Jenn was breathing a bit hard, and reached down to loosen her pants and give her smaller belly some room to expand. She then looked over at Claire, whom she noticed was staring wistfully at the empty tray.

"What's wrong sweetie?" She asked in concern, burping slightly as her food started to settle. Claire glanced guiltily at her mom and then looked down at her massive belly.

"Well... I'm still pretty hungry." Claire said, face reddening a bit. Jenn stared at her daughter for a few moments, and then smiled.

"That's nothing to be embarrassed about! I have plenty more food in the kitchen. Why don't I go make you some more?" With that Jenn rose slowly, grunting as she felt the food sloshing in her stuffed belly. Noticing that Claire still seemed rather embarrassed, she corrected herself. "Why don't I make us some more food?" Claire smiled up at her as her mother walked away. Little did Jenn know, it wasn't just Claire's embarrassment that had caused her to become flushed, but rather, the mere exertion of eating.

Jenn left her whale of a daughter in her room, and staggered down the hall, clutching her belly tightly. Stopping off in her bathroom to grab some Tums, she then made her way down to the kitchen and began preparing more food. That girl sure can put a lot away! She thought, slightly uneasy at the thought of having to eat so much more food. She glanced surreptitiously at the door to Ron's office, feeling a hot flash of anger. Well, she is a growing girl after all. If eating with her helps prove to her that she's healthy, well, then that's what I'll do!

Jenn looked at him, not quite seeming to understand.
"What do you mean?"
"Well, she's really put on some weight lately."
Jenn shrugged.
"Yeah, I guess she's filled out a bit… So what?"
"Honey, she's not just filling out, she's getting fat."
"Fat, what do you mean?"

Jenn shook her head, brushing him off with a laugh.
"Oh come on. It's not that bad. She's hardly bigger than me. Are you saying I'm fat?"
Ron sighed, giving his wife an exasperated look.
He had no illusions as to her appearance. The slim energetic cheerleader he had fallen in love with was long since gone. A decade of sedentary snacking and heavy meals had turned her into a round flabby housewife.
He did not find her doughy body particularly attractive, but he loved her and wanted her to be happy. However, with Claire well on her way to being as much of a butterball as his wife, he was starting to worry.

She can’t even walk up a flight of stairs without breaking into a sweat for god’s sake! As far as I can see she’s just sitting around and eating all day. She’s only 18 and she’s already as big as you. If we keep letting her live like this she’s gonna get huge! She’s not gonna be able to handle the world.”

“Now listen here! Claire’s 18, she’s a grown woman and how she spends her time is up to her. Anyways, there’s nothing wrong with her size. She’s not fat at all!”

And so started one of the first real arguments the couple had ever had. Claire might be getting to be an adult, but Ron wasn't going to let her turn herself into an obese porker under his roof. She turned her head to look as her father walked through the door. Some small smudges of chocolate were on her round cheeks.
“What is it?” She asked.
Ron sat down beside her.
“We need to talk hun.”
“About what?” She picked up another candy bar and dug in.
“Well, it’s just…”
He looked at his daughter, at her smile as she munched on her chocolaty treat. She looked so happy. Perhaps he should just leave it be.
A glance at her body convinced him otherwise. Her pale flabby flesh was bulging out of her clothes. Those things had been loose on her only a couple of months ago. How much had she piled on since then?
Her fleshy buttocks were peeking over the top of her pants. They’d always been one of her more plump features. But now they’d lost any sense of solid shape. They were doughy dimpled blobs of fat. Her little paunch had turned into a wobbling belly. Even her hands were plumper.
He couldn’t let her continue like this.
“You’ve been eating a lot lately. I’m worried that you’re starting to get a bit fat.”
Claire looked at him and laughed.
“Me, fat? Come on, you know there’s no way that’s true.”
“Honey, you really are getting to be pretty heavy.”
Claire rolled her eyes and gave her bulging waist a slap that sent ripples up and down her big jellybelly.
Ron sighed. This wasn’t going to be easy.
He reached his hands out and grabbed her flabby belly.
“Look, I can grab two whole handfuls of fat, and there’s still plenty to spare.”
Claire looked at the rolls of bellyflab in her father’s big hands and shrugged.
“Alright, maybe I’ve gotten a little thicker. But that’s nothing to worry about it. A bit of extra padding just highlights your curves.”
Claire’s extra padding was not so much highlighting her natural curves as hiding and distorting them, turning solid curves into sagging bulges of squishy flesh.
“Honey, you’ve got more than just a bit of extra padding. Almost half your body’s padding. You’re not thick or plump, you’re fat.”
“No I’m not!” Claire insisted, her lower lip trembling.
“Yes, you are.” He jiggled her flabby belly. “Just look at all this shaking fat. You really should go on a diet.
Claire didn’t know what to say. Her father was starting to break through her comfortable veil of ignorance. Her mind struggled as best it could to protect her precious delusions. She loved her food, loved her spoiled lazy life. The idea of a diet, of having to deny herself the food she loved, of having to sweat and struggle, it scared her like nothing else. It seemed like so much effort, and there was nothing Claire feared quite so much as having to make an effort.
The girl lived in a world of illusions. She truly did see herself as a shapely curvaceous stunner rather than as the out of shape heifer she really was.
She’d inherited her mother’s impressive capacity for self-deception. Her ability to ignore anything she didn’t want to see was truly impressive. But now that her delusions were being challenged she didn’t know what to do.
So she cried.
“How could you say that?” She wailed, tears in her eyes.
This Ron did not know how to handle.
“I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to…”
“Get out!” She shouted at him. “Get out!”
Ron did as he was told. Once he’d closed the door behind him he sighed and shook his head.
The girl was far too much like her mother.
Inside her room Claire unwrapped another several chocolate bars.
Why would her dad say that to her? Why would he be so mean?
Sure she was a bit round. But it wasn’t as if she was some kind of waddling 400 pound fatass, or some supersized blob too heavy to even get up by herself. She was just a bit curvy.
Full of indignation the blubbery butterball shoved several candy bars into her mouth.

"Don't be silly. You can't go all cold turkey like that. It'll only make it harder for you to lose weight. You can even gain some more doing that!"

"Really? Wow, I had no idea. So what should I do then?"

"Well, I can schedule an appointment with the family doctor as soon as I can. Until then I want you to eat just like you have been doing. You don't want risk making any wrong changes to your diet, right?"

"Yeah, you're right. I guess my health is the most important part. Thanks mom!"

"So, why don't you go have some cake while I call the doctor. I just brought some. I didn't know if you would prefer chocolate or strawberry, so I got both."

As soon as Claire got far enough, Jen called her old friend Dr. Susan. She wasn't a diet specialist, but being a doctor should be enough to convince her daughter, Jen thought. Also, Susan was fat positive, so it shouldn't be hard convincing her to help trick Claire. Jen could notice her friend got excited from the idea and, after a brief talk regarding their plan, they had a visit scheduled two weeks from then. Susan had plenty of availability before that, but they wanted to keep Claire eating normally a little longer.

When the visit day came, Claire was visibly fatter. Her clothes were showing her belly most of the time, and she was starting to get a bit conscious about it. Claire greeted Dr. Susan, who proceeded with the usual formalities and some measurement taking. Claire was now 167 pounds.

"Okay, Claire. So you have told me that you have gained some weight and that you wanted to slim down a bit, right? I have to say, your current weight doesn't sound that much high to me. What you may be experiencing is some body dysmorphia caused by you being unused to recent changes, and that's perfectly normal. If you really do want to lose some weight, I can still help you."

"Great. I'm already a little relieved to hear that it isn't as bad as I thought. But I'm listening."

"Well, you can start by tricking your brain into changing how it perceives your own body. Before your weight gain you were used to wearing clothes that were too small, so now they feel to tight, and this puts additional mental stress on you. The way to address this, is renewing your wardrobe, so as to negate the feeling of your old small clothes, so buying clothes a size or two bigger than your current size should do it."

Claire was writing down the instructions intently.

"Now, the thing people get wrong the most about diets is that simply by reducing your caloric intake you will lose weight. You won't. It all has to do with your metabolism. Right now, your body knows that you weigh 167 pounds, and it wants to stay like that. If you start eating less, your body will do whatever it can to keep your weight up. Conversely, if you rapidly eat more, your metabolism will rise. The more you increase your diet, the easier it will be to lose weight."

"Wow, I'm amazed I've seen so much misinformation about diet."

"Yes, this is why it is so important to check with a professional. Last, but not least, I want you to throw your scales away. Checking your progress too closely may hinder your motivation because most changes are more gradual than what we've been conditioned to expect. Plus, you wouldn't have the adequate equipment and the necessary control you will have checking your progress here with me. And remember, more important than meaningless numbers, is how you feel about your body."

"Thanks, Dr. Susan. This has been very informative."

Susan finally let her devilish smile out, as Claire exited the office. She wondered how she would look when she got back.

11231111.content:
Dr. Susan couldn't help but smile as Claire walked into her Office. Dutifully munching her way through a snickers bar the girl was bulging out of her clothes. Her diet had already had a noticeable effect on her figure. Her thighs had grown wider, her face softer. No longer shapely and firm her buttocks had filled out, turning into wobbling pillows of fat. Most of Claire's new weight however had settled on her waist, padding out her belly, which was starting to hang ever so slightly, and her prominent love handles. Her once trim waist had swelled into doughy muffin top that bulged out of her shirt and over the edge of her pants.

"So," Dr. Susan said, smiling at the girl; "your mother told me you wanted to talk?"

"Yeah," Claire nodded. "I'm just not sure about this diet. All my clothes are starting to feel so tight. I feel like I might have actually gained weight."

"Really," Dr. Susan said, her warm smile and soothing voice putting Claire at ease; "what gives you that idea?"

"Well, ever since I started this diet I've been feeling so bloated and tired. And look at this." Grabbing her bulging belly Claire easily squeezed herself a handful of soft flesh; "I don't think I used to have this much fat 'round my waist."

"Oh, is that it?" Susan responded, seeming more amused than concerned.

"Well, yeah." Claire answered, a bit perplexed at her Doctor's lack of concern.

"Well," Dr. Susan said, placing a friendly hand on Claire's chubby arm; "I wouldn't worry about that if I were you. It's perfectly natural?"

"It is?" Claire asked, furrowing her brow.

"Oh yes. Believe me, you haven't gained a single pound. Your mind is just finding it hard to adjust to the actual state of your figure. It's very common, especially in girls your age."

"Really?" Claire frowned, "but I feel like I've put on weight."

"I know you do, but that's just your mind playing tricks on you. As far as I can tell you actually look like you've lost a couple of pounds already."

At that Claire perked up.

"Do I really?"

"Oh yes," Dr. Susan reassured her.

Placing a hand on Claire's bulging midriff she squeezed her fingers into the girl's soft, yielding flesh.

"Your waist has definitely shrunk. And these," she gave Claire's flabby thighs a slight pat; "feel firmer than they did at the start of the month. Why don't you step on the scale so we can see how much you've lost?"

Claire eagerly agreed.

Having had ample time to prepare for Claire's arrival Dr. Susan had long since set the scale up so that it registered anything put on it as about 15 pounds lighter than it really was.

Watching with baited breath as the numbers on the scale climbed Claire let out a little shriek of joy as the digital display settled 163 pounds.

"Look, I've lost four pounds!" She beamed.

"Congratulations!" Dr. Susan grinned.

Relieved Claire sat her flabby buttocks back down on her chair.

"I guess you were right, I guess I was just worrying over nothing. Still," she frowned, "for almost a month of dieting that's not a very big loss."

"Better than nothing though." Dr. Susan said, putting a hand on the girl's shoulder. "I know you're eager for results, but these things take time. You need to have patience. You need to trust that this will work. If you follow my instructions you will lose weight. Do you understand?"

Claire nodded.

"Good." Dr. Susan smiled. "If something seems wrong, if your clothes feel tight, that's just your mind playing tricks on you. It's perfectly normal. You should ignore it if you can, if not... well, you should probably just try some stretchier clothes. You need to keep this going. In fact, if you can you should probably eat a little more than you already do."

"I think I can do that." Claire grinned. "There's one other thing though." She said, her expression turning serious. "What about exercise? I've been feeling kinda sluggish for the last couple of weeks. If I want to lose weight shouldn't I be exercising more?"

"Certainly not." Dr. Susan said, shaking her head. "That's a common misconception. At this point you should avoid exercise to whatever degree possible. It might wear your body out and make it start to store more calories."

"Really?" Claire said, scrunching up her nose and raising one befuddled eyebrow.

"Really." Dr. Susan emphasized. "If you want to keep the pounds melting off your figure you should try to keep away from any form of strenuous physical activity. Do you think you can do that?"

"I don't think that should be a problem." Claire grinned.

"Good," Dr. Susan smiled. "You're doing very well. Come back here in a couple of months and we'll see how much you've lost then."

As Claire and her mother left the Doctor Susan's office the girl was in high spirits, her belly jiggling as she skipped down the front steps.

"Do I look thinner to you mom?" She asked, striking a pose.

Jenn studied her daughter's figure. With her belly bulging out over her waistband, her sleeves digging into her fleshy arms, and her thick thighs and blubbery backside straining against the fabric of her pants Claire was definitely not thin.

"You look beautiful honey."

"Thanks." Claire beamed.

"Now then, why don't we go get you a nice, big meal. We need to keep that diet of yours up after all."

"Oh yes," Claire agreed. "I'm starving, I haven't eaten anything in hours."

"Well," her mother corrected; "you did have four snickers bars before we got here."

"Yeah, but that was just a snack." Claire said, rolling her eyes. "I need a real meal."

As the two of them got into their car and drove off Claire grinned.

"I can't wait 'til summer rolls around. I'm gonna look so good in my bikini."

At that Jenn too couldn't help but smile. Summer was months away. By then her daughter would have put on plenty of weight. Her body would be a collection of drooping rolls, soft, shapeless fat bulging and sagging out of whatever swimwear she could find in her size.

125312.content:
Claire frowned at the excess amount of food that had been piled high on her clean white cafeteria tray.

Look at it all! Two burgers, extra helpings of mashed potatoes (with extra gravy!) and a double portion of fries. Didn't these stupid new sponsors for her school realize that this much starch was unhealthy? Her meal was like, 75% potato. And since it was almost twice as big as any of the other lunches she'd had since these new wackos took over, that was like... 150% potato. Wait.

In her senior year of high school, Claire White was ready and willing to get this over with. She'd been dealing with the same people in and out since elementary school (the curse of small town living, she supposed). And even though she wanted change, everything seemed to be changing in all the wrong ways! Her mom was harping on her about being "too skinny" all of the sudden, they'd gotten a new principal and all of these weird new rules about how they were supposed to "conduct themselves properly." It was all a load of bull, if you asked her.

Not that anyone would ever dare ask Claire what she wanted...

So the only thing she could do was scowl at her two burgers, her double helping of potatoes, and her little hillock of fries.

Weird. Why wouldn't they just give everyone the same amount?

"Jeez Claire, you hungry today?" a sudden voice ripped Claire from her introspection as a chair pulled from underneath the table and joined her for lunch, "You've got like twice as much as me."

Claire and Lexie Treckman had been friends since tenth grade, something born of necessity rather than common interests. Lexie was alone in English, Claire was alone in English… so they cobbled together a sort of immediate friendship together to fill in that awkward hour first thing in the morning.

It had stuck well into their respective Junior years, though not very well, and stuck with them into their final year of high school. They were friends, yes, in the sense that neither one said anything too terribly mean behind the other one’s back. But ultimately they were hardly acquaintances—they weren’t close enough to keep up the façade when they didn’t have a class in common (or lunch in this case; they were the only members of their social circle with this lunch period), and you could count the amount of times they’d hung out together outside of school on one hand.

Where Claire was short and had soft features with a certainly enviable set of curves, Lexie was taller, lankier, and cut an overall sharper figure. This was probably one of the reasons Lexie chose to pick on poor Claire every now and then, but that was a story for another time.

"Yeah, I have no idea why they gave me so much." Claire grumbled, "I'm never going to finish it all."

"Yeah? You mind if I have some?" the taller girl said, already reaching over to take some of Claire's fries, "I skipped breakfast today and I'm starved."

"Be my guest. I need to cut back." Claire thought sourly of her soft tum and "womanly" hips. No matter what her mother said, Claire felt that she was anything but too skinny.

"I mean, you said it, not me." Lexie snorted as she pulled Claire's tray closer, "Ooh, these are good..."

Well, that was one problem solved. It was probably just a fluke, Claire figured. There was no way that she would intentionally be getting any more or less food than anyone else in school, right? What kind of weird conspiracy theorist would come up with that?

And besides, she really could stand to cut back a little...
